metadata.name: Zone
metadata.description: A Zone object is used to interact with your project's managed zone. It will help you add or delete records, delete your zone, and many other convenience methods.

examples.code: zone.exists(function(err, exists) {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

metadata.name: get
metadata.description:
Get a zone if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

examples.code: zone.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

params.name: callback.metadata
params.description: • Metadata of the zone from the API.

metadata.name: addRecords
metadata.description: Add records to this zone. This is a convenience wrapper around .

metadata.name: change
metadata.description: Create a reference to a change object in this zone.

examples.code: var change = zone.change('change-id');

metadata.name: createChange
metadata.description: Create a change of resource record sets for the zone.

params.name: config.add
params.description: • Record objects to add to this zone.

params.name: config.delete
params.description: • Record objects to delete from this zone. Be aware that the resource records here must match exactly to be deleted.

metadata.name: delete
metadata.description:
Delete the zone.

Only empty zones can be deleted. Set options.force to true to call before deleting the zone. Two API calls will then be made (one to empty, another to delete), which means this is not an atomic request.

examples.caption: Use force to first empty the zone before deleting it.

metadata.name: deleteRecords
metadata.description:
Delete records from this zone. This is a convenience wrapper around .

This method accepts objects or string record types in its place. This means that you can delete all A records or NS records, etc. If used this way, two API requests are made (one to get, then another to delete), which means the operation is not atomic and could result in unexpected changes.

examples.caption: Delete multiple records at once.
Possibly a simpler way to perform the above change is deleting records by type.
examples.code: zone.deleteRecords('ns', callback);

examples.caption: You can also delete records of multiple types.
examples.code: zone.deleteRecords(['ns', 'a'], callback);

params.name: record
params.description: • If given a string, it is interpreted as a record type. All records that match that type will be retrieved and then deleted. You can also provide a object or array of objects.

metadata.name: empty
metadata.description: Emptying your zone means leaving only 'NS' and 'SOA' records. This method will first fetch the non-NS and non-SOA records from your zone using , then use to create a deletion change.

metadata.name: export
metadata.description: Provide a path to a zone file to copy records into the zone.

params.name: localPath
params.description: • The fully qualified path to the zone file.

metadata.name: getChanges
metadata.description: Get the list of changes associated with this zone. A change is an atomic update to a collection of records.

examples.caption: Get the changes from your zone as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query.sort
params.description: • Set to 'asc' for ascending, and 'desc' for descending or omit for no sorting.

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • A query object representing the next page of results.

metadata.name: getRecords
metadata.description: Get the list of records for this zone.

examples.caption: Provide a query for further customization.
Get the records from your zone as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.
If you only want records of a specific type or types, provide them in place of the query object.
You can also specify multiple record types.

params.name: query.name
params.description: • Restricts the list to return only records with this fully qualified domain name.

params.name: query.type
params.description: • Restricts the list to return only records of this type. If present, the "name" parameter must also be present.

params.name: query.maxResults
params.description: • Maximum number of results to be returned.

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • A query object representing the next page of results.

metadata.name: import
metadata.description: Copy the records from a zone file into this zone.

params.name: localPath
params.description: • The fully qualified path to the zone file.

metadata.name: record
metadata.description:
A object can be used to construct a record you want to add to your zone, or to refer to an existing one.

Note that using this method will not itself make any API requests. You will use the object returned in other API calls, for example to add a record to your zone or to delete an existing one.

examples.caption: Reference an existing record to delete from your zone.
Construct a record to add to your zone.
Use these records together to create a change.

params.name: type
params.description: • The type of record to construct or the type of record you are referencing.

params.name: metadata.data
params.description: • Defined in RFC 1035, section 5 and RFC 1034, section 3.6.1.

params.name: metadata.ttl
params.description: • Seconds that the resource is cached by resolvers.

metadata.name: replaceRecords
metadata.description:
Provide a record type that should be deleted and replaced with other records.

This is not an atomic request. Two API requests are made (one to get records of the type that you've requested, then another to replace them), which means the operation is not atomic and could result in unexpected changes.
